result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Alan Anderson

Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:03 AM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel  ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Michael Alan Anderson appeared. S/T Officer Holden Timm; Hudson PD; direct by Atty Brekken. Cross by Atty Dolfi. Redirect by Atty Brekken. Recross by Atty Dolfi. Attys argue bindover. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Brekken notes no additional charges will be brought. Atty Dolfi and DE would like to proceed with ARGN. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Next hearing in person. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues in form and amoutn. Adjourned: 9:20 am  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Fleet Farm.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood. DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi. DE: Michael Alan Anderson appears. DE has received a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Qualifies for PD services. Atty Dolfi waives further reading and time limits for speedy preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
